newsitem.title: TURKEY: ISTANBUL EXCHANGE TO LIST PAINT PRODUCER MEGES.
newsitem.headline: ISTANBUL EXCHANGE TO LIST PAINT PRODUCER MEGES.

text.p: The Istanbul Stock Exchange said partial shares of Turkish paint producer Meges Boya Sanayi ve Ticaret A.S. would be listed on the national market on Friday at an opening price of 6,200 lira per 1,000 lira nominal-valued share.
Meges Boya offered 50 billion lira nominal-valued shares to public at 6,200 lira fixed price per share share on April 29-30 when raising its capital to 250 billion lira from 200 billion.

Finans Yatirim securities which managed the public offer said Republic National Bank of New York (Suisse) S.A. bought 11 billion lira, 945 domestic individual investors bought 34.602 billion lira and seven domestic institutional investors got 4.398 billion lira worth shares from the offer.
Meges, largely owned by Mercan Holding and family, produces water-based, synthetic paints used in construction as well as industrial paints.
Its 1996 output was 8,284 tonnes, up from 7,366 tonnes in 1995, compared to an overall annual capacity of 16,000 tonnnes.

The company reported a 268 percent jump in net profits to 42 billion lira and a 163 percent increase in net sales to 1.08 trillion lira in 1996 when compared to a year ago. Turkey's wholesale inflation was 84.9 percent last year.
Meges earlier said income from the public offer would be used to finance investments to further diversify products and improve productivity.
Its 1997 targets are 275 billion lira of net profits and 2.5 trillion lira of turnover.
